articles.author: JB, FinOps Product Dept. Director & Core CS Team Lead
articles.description:
New!
Â Â 
Today, we are glad to announce yet a new feature: a brand new Dashboard section that will allow you to easily manage your daily tasks, directly from your Smily account.
Here is a sneak peek at what the new Dashboard looks like:

In the past, managing day to day operations may have been complicated. Tasks such as keeping track of payments, approving pending tentatives and others were time consuming.
Thanks to the Dashboard, you now have access to the following information:
List of pending tentatives: to help you convert them into confirmed bookings, or cancel them to free up the dates in your calendar
List of bookings with missing payments: to help you get all your payments on time and never miss a payment again
List of arrivals of the day: to help you plan the check-in of your guests
List of departures of the day: to help you plan the check-out of your guests
You can find more details in the dedicated manual article, and a video guided tour of the new Dashboard section will soon be added there as well.
We invite you to explore this new Dashboard, and hope it will help you save time and better manage your daily operations. Some improvements will also be made in the future, such as adding performance metrics to help you manage your business more easily.
articles.title: [New feature] Brand new Dashboard section to easily manage your daily tasks from Smily ðŸš€

articles.author: Yannick, Customer Care Team Leader - Pro Team
articles.description:
New!
Â Â 
At BookingSync, we are here to make you Save time and Book more. That's why we are always thrilled to announce more and more features.
This time the new feature concerns the reviews management, you can now manage all your reviews on BookingSync. Yes ! all the reviews posted on the biggest channels : Airbnb, Booking.com plus your direct bookings.
When accessing the Reviews section, you will see 2 different sub-menus:
Guest Reviews: This section will allow you to see the different reviews posted by the guests for each property, the rating plus the message posted by the guest, if you need more detail you can click on the review, a new page will appear with the Review details, the Booking details, the complete guest review message, and the host review if itâ€™s already posted, and you have the possibility to reply to the review message.


Host Reviews: This section will allow you to evaluate your guest and share a detailed rating and a review message.


For each of these section you will be able to filter the reviews by Rating, Rentals and Source.
Please find here the video demo explaining step by step the feature.
We invite you to discover all these new features, and hope it will help you to have a better management of your reviews, save more time, and have a better ranking and visibility on the channels !
Donâ€™t hesitate to contact our customer care if you have any questions.
articles.title: [New feature] Manage all your reviews from your BookingSync Account !

Expected Impact:
During this period, App Platform users may experience new App creation failing or being delayed, as well as domain updates to existing Apps failing or being delayed. Our Engineering team will be monitoring throughout the maintenance window for any issues.

Users may have experienced up to 90 minutes of delay in Apps deploying, seeing "Deploy pending" messages in the control panel. Existing Apps were not impacted and remained online. Aug 12, 01:34 UTC
Resolved - Our Engineering team has completed work to identify remaining emails impacted by this incident. At this time, there remains a small subset of emails not being delivered to users, including some billing emails like finalized invoices and billing threshold alerts, App Platform alerts, and DBaaS alerts. Multiple teams are working together to ensure that these emails are able to be sent out correctly and that work will continue. 
At this time, we are going to resolve the incident due to critical email functionality being restored. If you have any concerns about the remaining emails impacted, or any questions about this incident, please open a support ticket from within your account. 
Thank you for your patience throughout this process and we apologize for the extenâ€¦

Resolved - Our Engineering team has observed mitigated impact for this issue, due to actions taken upstream. Users should no longer experience any network latency/packet loss on Droplets and Droplet-based services from SGP to the EU region. App Platform health checks should now pass as expected. 
We apologize for the inconvenience. If you're still experiencing any issues, please open a support ticket.
Aug 11, 14:26 UTC
Investigating - Our Engineering team is aware of an upstream issue impacting network connectivity from SGP to the EU region. During this time, users may experience network latency/packet loss on Droplets and Droplet-based services from SGP to the EU region. 
We are also seeing App Platform health checks fail as a result of this issue.
Our Engineering team is investigating any possible mitigations to work around this upstream issue. We will provide an update as soon as further information is available.
articles.title: Transit Network connectivity in SGP1 region

Aug 10, 03:59 UTC
Scheduled - Start: 2022-08-10 04:00 UTC
End: 2022-08-10 08:00 UTC 
During the above window, we will be performing maintenance in our TOR1 region as part of network upgrades.
Expected Impact:
During this period, inbound and outbound traffic between TOR1 and the rest of the DO network may experience a couple of brief (5-10 second) interruptions as traffic is isolated from each TOR1 core switch prior to being upgraded. We will endeavor to keep any such impact to a minimum.
If you have any questions or concerns regarding this maintenance, please send us a ticket from your Cloud support page.
articles.title: Networking Maintenance in TOR1

articles.description:
Incident began at 2022-09-07 16:00 and ended at 2022-09-07 23:34 (times are in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)).

The problem with Gmail has been resolved. We apologize for the inconvenience and thank you for your patience and continued support.

The issue with accessing Workspace services has been resolved for the vast majority of affected users as of Wednesday, 2022-09-07 16:28 US/Pacific.

We will publish an analysis of this incident once we have completed our internal investigation.

We thank you for your patience while we worked on resolving the issue.

Affected products: Gmail
articles.title: RESOLVED: We're investigating reports of an issue with Gmail. We will provide more information shortly.

articles.description:
Incident began at 2022-09-07 16:00 and ended at 2022-09-07 23:34 (times are in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)).

We are continuing to investigate this issue. We will provide an update by Sep 7, 2022, 11:15 PM UTC detailing when we expect to resolve the problem.

Only User accounts which were created after 07 September 2022 09:00 US/Pacific or whose domain policies/subscriptions that have been modified since that time, are believed to be affected by this issue.

The following is the error users when trying to access Gmail:

Weâ€™re sorry, but your account is temporarily unavailable. We apologize for the inconvenience and suggest trying again in a few minutes.You can view the Google Workspace Status Dashboard for the current status of the service. Numeric Code: 7354

The affected Users (created after 07 September 2022 09:00 US/Pacific or whose domain policies/subscriptions that have been modified since that time) may experience issues while accessing other Workspace services too.

No workarounds at this time.

Affected products: Gmail

articles.description:
Incident began at 2022-09-04 04:00 and ended at 2022-09-07 14:39 (times are in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)).

We apologize for the inconvenience this service disruption/outage may have caused. We would like to provide some information about this incident below. Please note, this information is based on our best knowledge at the time of posting and is subject to change as our investigation continues. If you have experienced impact outside of what is listed below, please reach out to Google Workspace Support using the help article https://support.google.com/a/answer/1047213.

(All Times US/Pacific)

Incident Start: 03 September 2022 21:00

Incident End: 07 September 2022 07:39

Duration: 3 days, 10 hours, 39 minutes

Affected Services and Features:

Google Calendar

Regions/Zones: Chile

Description:

Google Calendar experienced an issue with a mismatch in daylight savings time in Chile. The issue was caused due to the decision of the Government of Chile to delay the time change by a week from 3 September 2022 to 10 September 2022.

Following the announcement of the Chilean Governmentâ€™s decision on 8 August 2022, Google product teams evaluated options to minimize customer impact. After careful analysis, the Calendar product team decided to not roll out an ad-hoc fix due to the number of variables involved with the fix roll out. So, the Google team published an external blog post on 1 September 2022, outlining the Governmentâ€™s decision to delay the time change and workarounds to prepare the customers in Chile for the best time change experience.

Upon receiving multiple customer escalations on 5 September 2022, the product team reconvened and decided to roll out the emergency fix to mitigate the impact to our customers.

Customer Impact:

Events in the calendar for the week of 3 September 2022 to 10 September 2022 were not in the right time for users who have events saved in the Chilean time zone or if the user's calendar is set to Chile time zone. Current time displayed on the customers calendars is an hour later than the actual time.

Affected products: Google Calendar
articles.title: RESOLVED: We're aware of a problem with Google Calendar affecting a significant subset of users. We will provide an update by Sep 6, 2022, 7:07 AM UTC detailing when we expect to resolve the problem. Please note that this resolution time is an estimate and may change.

articles.description:
Incident began at 2022-09-04 04:00 and ended at 2022-09-07 14:39 (times are in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)).

The problem with Google Calendar has been resolved. We apologize for the inconvenience and thank you for your patience and continued support.

Affected products: Google Calendar
articles.title: RESOLVED: We're aware of a problem with Google Calendar affecting a significant subset of users. We will provide an update by Sep 6, 2022, 7:07 AM UTC detailing when we expect to resolve the problem. Please note that this resolution time is an estimate and may change.

articles.description:
Incident began at 2022-09-06 19:49 and ended at 2022-09-07 02:04 (times are in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)).

We apologize for the inconvenience this service disruption/outage may have caused. We would like to provide some information about this incident below. Please note, this information is based on our best knowledge at the time of posting and is subject to change as our investigation continues. If you have experienced impact outside of what is listed below, please reach out to Google Workspace Support using the help article https://support.google.com/a/answer/1047213.

(All Times US/Pacific)

Incident Start: 06 September 2022 12:49

Incident End: 06 September 2022 19:04

Duration: 6 hours, 15 minutes

Affected Services and Features:

Google Chat - Smart Reply feature

Regions/Zones: Global

Description:

Google Chat experienced an issue where Chat Smart Reply features were not available for the users for a duration of 6 hours, 15 minutes. From preliminary analysis, the root cause of the issue is a regular maintenance activity which inadvertently deleted the backend models supporting the feature. The issue was resolved by restoring the backend models.

Customer Impact:

Customers were unable to use Chat Smart Reply features for the duration of the outage. The other functionality of Google Chat including sending and receiving messages were not affected.

Affected products: Google Chat
articles.title: RESOLVED: We are continuing to investigate this issue. We will provide an update by Sep 7, 2022, 12:00 AM UTC detailing when we expect to resolve the problem.

articles.description:
To clear the "Slack cannot connect" message, users should try clearing cache by going to "Help" > "Troubleshooting" > "Clear Cache and Restart".


If the issue persists after or if you're unable to open the desktop app, please uninstall the Windows Store version and reinstall the Direct Download version by following these instructions:


1. Quit Slack (Ctrl + Q) and make sure there are no Slack.exe or Update.exe processes running in Task Manager.

2. On Windows 10, open the Start menu and head to Settings > Apps & features. Find Slack in the list that appears and click the option to Uninstall.

3. Open a Run dialog (Windows Key + R).

4. Enter the following path: C:\Users\%USERNAME%\AppData\Local\Packages\91750D7E.Slack_8she8kybcnzg4\LocalCache\Roaming

5. Delete the Slack folder from the directory that launches.

6. Reinstall Slack from our website: https://slack.com/downloads/windows
articles.title: Incident: Windows Store app users may experience an error when launching Slack

articles.description:
Our service provider has resolved the issue and email ticket creation is now working as expected. 


Thank you for your patience while we sorted this out.
articles.title: Notice: Email ticket creation may not be working.

articles.description:
Issue summary:

From August 31, 2022 at 7:24 PM PDT to September 1, 2022 at 12:15 AM PDT, some customers experienced visual trouble with the Slack interface. Multiple message attachments overlapped, making them inaccessible. 


We traced this to a recent code change, which we reversed â€” resolving trouble for all affected users.
articles.title: Incident: Issues with the Slack interface

articles.description:
Issue summary:

From Monday August 29 at 10:11 AM PDT to Wednesday August 31st at 12:42 PM PDT, some Grid customers were running into errors when configuring SSO settings for their workspaces. Upon investigation, we identified an issue that was resulting in empty SAML configuration files. These empty files triggered the errors seen by users.


Removing the offending file fixed the issue for all affected users.
articles.title: Incident: Issues setting up SSO for some users.

articles.description:
Issue summary: 

From August 29, 2022 at 11:26 AM PDT to August 30, 2022 at 3:56 PM PDT, some customers may have experienced issues with their Mark as Read preferences, and intermittent issues loading channel history.


When you view a channel, Slack remembers your last scroll position so we can take you back to the same place. A recent feature update inadvertently bypassed the check for this scroll position, creating the impression that Slack wasn't respecting your Mark as Read preference. Additionally, this incorrectly prevented channel history from loading for some users.


We identified the root cause and rolled this code change back, resolving the issue for all affected customers.
articles.title: Incident: Mark as Read preferences not being respected

articles.description:
Issue Summary: 

On August 25, 2022 between 11:31 AM PDT and 12:37 PM PDT, some customers experienced trouble loading the Workflow Builder screen.


We traced the problem to a change in the front-end Workflow Builder components which prevented the Workflow Builder from starting up successfully. We reverted this, resolving the issue for all affected customers.
articles.title: Incident: Workflow Builder screen not loading

articles.description:
Issue Summary:

From August 22, 2022 5:15 PM PDT to August 23, 2022 01:15 AM PDT, some customers experienced a persistent reload prompt when when their user account was converted from a member account to a guest account, even after a reload was completed.


A recent change made to our code resulted in the removal of a mechanism for indicating when a reload dialogue should appear. We have pushed a fix for this problem by reinstating the mechanism to ensure this only occurs for users once.
articles.title: Incident: Some users are encountering a "Reload required" message

articles.description:
Issue Summary:


On August 23, 2022 between 12:17 PM PDT and 1:32 PM PDT, some customers experienced difficulty with loading Slack and sending messages. This occurred when a group of database servers became overloaded and failed.


We first reduced the load on our infrastructure manually. The issue was then resolved when our automated processes kicked in, replacing the damaged server with a healthy one. While the issue is resolved, we will continue to investigate the root cause to avoid these problems in the future.
articles.title: Incident: Trouble loading and sending messages in Slack

articles.description:
Issue Summary: 

From August 19, 2022 11:55 AM PDT to August 22, 2022 2:52 AM PDT some users experienced issues using the buttons on interactive messages. 


We traced the issue to a recent code change, which we rolled back, resolving the issue for all impacted users.
articles.title: Incident: Errors with interactive messages

articles.description:
Issue summary:

From 1:13Â  PM PDT to 6:56 PM PDT on August 15, 2022 some customers experienced issues in the desktop app when sending messages or reactions with Japanese character emojis.


We identified the issue was the result of a code change to how emojis were validated. We reverted the change which resolved the issue for all affected users.
articles.title: Incident: Issues with sending messages with custom emoji

articles.description:
Issue summary:

On August 9, 2022 at 10:59 AM PDT, customers on organizations with Enterprise Key Management (EKM) enabled began experiencing trouble with loading messages, threads, and workflows. The issues were due an update that reduced the capacity across EKM, causing a surge of traffic.


To fix this, we redistributed the EKM workload to increase capacity, resolving the trouble for customers on August 9, 2022 at 11:49AM PDT. 


Note: The wording of this summary has been slightly modified to improve readability.
articles.title: Incident: Trouble with DMs, Threads, and Workflows

articles.description:
Issue summary:

From August 8 at 10:44 PM PDT until August 9 at 6:23 AM PDT, some customers may have been unable to download files which caused a blurry preview image to appear. 

We traced the issue to one of the file servers which was failing while under high-load. Engineers have updated the affected file server which fixed the issue for all affected customers.
articles.title: Incident: Trouble with uploading and downloading files in Slack
